data.title: Miller High Lifeâs champagne-sized bottles make a comeback
data.meta_description: Miller High Life is bringing back its Champagne of Beers bottles with an updated design for 2019, the company said.
data.text:
Miller High Life is getting all dressed up for the holiday season.

The companyâs Champagne of Beers is relaunching its champagne-sized 750-ml. bottles for another year.

âReception was so good across the country last year that it was a no-brainer to bring it back for 2019,â Nigel Jones, the marketing manager for the Miller family of brands, said. âThe attention our distinctive champagne bottle commands not only is a great marketing tool to boost brand equity, but it gets the Champagne of Beers into more holiday moments.â

Featuring an updated design for 2019, the bottles feature necks wrapped in gold foil sealed with the Girl in the Moon logo, as well as the words âThe Champagne of Beersâ in raised glass letters, and a slight diagonal orientation framed in gold and green, the company said.

âEven though beer remains the top-selling category over the holiday season, wine and spirits have an outsized influence at retail,â Jones said. âOur champagne bottle program opens that door and gets us on the floor during a time of year when we werenât really getting there before.â

In addition, Miller High Life will send select bars and restaurants branded champagne coupe glassware that can be used for building Champagne of Beer towers to add a bit of retail theater to celebrations, the company said.

âMost drinkers know what High Life is and what we stand for, but we need to let them know why weâre special,â Jones said. âThis is one way in that gets people talking about us again.â

Those in New York City are also in for a special treat. During the second week of December, a custom champagne bottle vending machine stocked with 150 bottles at each new location will be making its way around the city. The bottles will be free to consumers on a first-come, first-serve basis.

âPeople are pumped when they see them, and it makes them want to go out and buy a couple,â Jones added. âAs soon as these bottles start hitting the floor, we see a ton of excitement and a flood of photos on social media. The rule of thumb is that if you see it once, jump on it because it tends to sell out quickly.â
